intro: Critonia tenuifolia, commonly known as slender leaf critonia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance, it is appreciated by gardeners interested in cultivating native plants.
